[[DERIVATIVES]]unalienable adj.不可予夺的，不可转让的

MEANING:

[MEANING 1]n. 一致: a state of consistency

[MEANING 3]vt.授予，给予: to grant or give especially as appropriate, due, or earned
[EXAMPLE]Women were finally accorded the right to vote in 1920.女性最终在 1920 年获得了投票权。

[MEANING 2]adj.无强烈感情的，冷淡的: lacking in friendliness or warmth of feeling
DESC:
[MEANING 1]adj.寒冷的: having a low or subnormal temperature
[EXAMPLE]a frosty autumn that was a sign of the brutal winter that followed 一个极为寒冷的秋天，它象征着随之而来的、可能更加残暴的冬季
[SYNONYMS]algid, arctic, bitter, chilling, coldish, cool, freezing, frigid, gelid, glacial, icy, nippy, numbing, polar, snappy
[ANTONYM]ardent, blazing, burning, fervent, fervid, molten, roasting, scalding, scorching, searing, sultry, sweltering, torrid 炎热的
[MEANING 2]adj.无强烈感情的，冷淡的: lacking in friendliness or warmth of feeling
[EXAMPLE]She gave the telemarketer on the phone a frosty "No, thank you" and hung up. 她向电话那头的推销员冷冷地说了一句“不，谢谢”之后就挂掉了电话。
[SYNONYMS]antiseptic, apathetic, brittle, chilly, cold-blooded, frozen, indifferent, unfriendly, unsympathetic, wintry
[ANTONYM]cordial, friendly, genial, hearty, sympathetic, warm, warm-blooded, warmhearted 友善的，热心的

MEANING: [MEANING 1]n.明喻: a figure of speech comparing two unlike things that is often introduced by like or as
DESC:
[MEANING 1]n.明喻: a figure of speech comparing two unlike things that is often introduced by like or as
[EXAMPLE]Even though both similes and metaphors are forms of comparison, similes indirectly compare the two ideas and allow them to remain distinct in spite of their similarities, whereas metaphors compare two things directly. For instance, a simile that compares a person with a bullet would go as follows: "Chris was a record-setting runner as fast as a speeding bullet." A metaphor might read something like, "When Chris ran, he was a speeding bullet racing along the track." 尽管明喻和暗喻都是比喻的手法，明喻会间接地对两个对象进行比较，[SYNONYMS]时允许差异的 存在，而暗喻则直接对两者进行比较。比如说，用明喻来把一个人比作子弹会这样说: “克里斯是一个不断打破记 录的选手，他跑得就和高速子弹一样快。”而暗喻可能会说: “当克里斯奔跑的时候，他就是一颗在赛场上高速飞行 的子弹。”
[ANTONYM]metaphor 暗喻

MEANING:

[MEANING 3]vt.重复，ANTONYM复: to do over or again often needlessly
[EXAMPLE]We were unable to duplicate the experiment with the same result in our own lab, so we're suspicious.我们不能在自己的实验室中重复之前的实验并得到相[SYNONYMS]的结果，因此我们很怀疑。

MEANING:

[MEANING 3]adj.迫切的: needing immediate attention

[MEANING 1]n.命令: a statement of what to do that must be obeyed by those concerned

[MEANING 2]adj.命令的，强制性的: forcing one's compliance or participation by or as if by law

[ANTONYM]optional可选择的；voluntary志愿性的
[MEANING 3]adj.迫切的: needing immediate attention
[EXAMPLE]an imperative need for medical supplies in the earthquake-ravaged country 地震灾区国家对于医疗物资的迫切需求
[SYNONYMS]clamant, compelling, critical, crying, emergent, exigent, imperious, importunate, pressing, urgent
[ANTONYM]n.oncritical, unimportant 不重要的
[MEANING 4]adj.必要的: impossible to do without
[EXAMPLE]Proper equipment is imperative for the success of this chemical experiment.合适的仪器是这个化学实验成功必不可少的条件
[SYNONYMS]indispensable, necessary, necessitous, requisite, vital
[ANTONYM]dispensable, inessential, needless, unnecessary 非必须的

[EXAMPLE]the fabulous endurance of a marathon runner马拉松参赛者令人惊讶的耐力

[MEANING 4]adj.极好的: extremely pleasing or successful

[MEANING 2]adj. 一知半解的，略懂的: not having or showing a deep understanding of something
DESC:
[MEANING 1]adj.无感觉，无知觉的: lacking perception, consciousness, or animation
[EXAMPLE]He refused to believe that the universe as we know it evolved from the random interactions of insentient particles of matter. 他拒绝相信我们所知的宇宙是经由无生命的粒子间的相互作用演化而来的
[SYNONYMS]impassive, insensate, insensible, senseless, unresponsive
[ANTONYM]perceiving, sensible, sensitive 有知觉的
[MEANING 2]adj. 一知半解的，略懂的: not having or showing a deep understanding of something
[EXAMPLE]an insentient therapist who failed to see what the teenager's real problem was一个对这名青少年的真正问题所在一知半解的医生
[SYNONYMS]impercipient, unwise
[ANTONYM]discerning, insightful 深邃的，有洞察力的；sagacious, sage, sapient 睿智的

MEANING: [MEANING 1]adj.疏忽的，不留心的: exhibiting carelessness or slackness
DESC:
[MEANING 1]adj.疏忽的，不留心的: exhibiting carelessness or slackness
[EXAMPLE] I would be remiss if I didn't tell you how much I appreciated the lovely gift.如果我不告诉你我是多么的喜欢这个可爱的礼物的话，那我就太疏忽大意了。
[SYNONYMS]careless, derelict, disregardful, heedless, lax, lazy, neglectful, neglecting, slack
[ANTONYM]attentive, careful, conscientious, meticulous, painstaking, scrupulous 细致的，仔细的

MEANING: [MEANING 1]vt.放弃，摒弃: to solemnly or formally reject or go back on (as something formerly adhered to)
DESC:
[MEANING 1]vt.放弃，摒弃: to solemnly or formally reject or go back on (as something formerly adhered to)
[EXAMPLE]She refused to renege the principles by which she had always lived her life, even if it resulted in losing her business. 尽管有可能使她失去她的事业，但她仍然拒绝放弃她在生命中所坚持的那些原则。
[SYNONYMS]abnegate, forswear, recant, renounce, repeal, repudiate, retract, withdraw
[ANTONYM]adhere 坚持
[[DERIVATIVES]]renegade n.叛徒

MEANING:
[MEANING 1]adj.(机器等)自动的: acting or operating in a manner essentially independent of external influence or control
[MEANING 2]adj.自发的，情不自禁的: acting or done spontaneously or unconsciously
DESC:
[MEANING 1]adj.(机器等)自动的: acting or operating in a manner essentially independent of external influence or control
[EXAMPLE]Will your next car be a manual or an automatic? 你下辆车是手动挡还是自动挡？ Modern subwaysare equipped with automatic screen doors. 现代地铁都装备了 自动屏蔽门。
[SYNONYMS]automated, robotic, self-acting, self-operating, self-regulating
[ANTONYM]manual 手动的
[MEANING 2]adj.自发的，情不自禁的: acting or done spontaneously or unconsciously
[EXAMPLE]Carl's automatic use of the brakes narrowly averted a collision.卡尔不经意间所踩的刹车勉强避免了一场车祸。
[SYNONYMS]impulsive, instinctive, involuntary, mechanic, mechanical, natural, spontaneous
[ANTONYM]calculated, deliberate, intentional, planned, predetermined, premeditated, studied 有计划的，蓄意的
[[DERIVATIVES]]automatically adv.自动地

MEANING:
[MEANING 1]adj.令人愉悦的: pleasing to the mind or senses especially as according well with one's tastes or needs
[MEANING 2]adj.随和的: having an easygoing and pleasing manner especially in social situations
[MEANING 3]adj.相一致的: being in harmony
DESC:
[MEANING 1]adj.令人愉悦的: pleasing to the mind or senses especially as according well with one's tastes or needs
[EXAMPLE]Would you mind putting on some agreeable music for dinner ？ 你介意为晚饭放一些令人愉快的音乐 吗？the agreeable melancholy resulting from a sense of the transitoriness of natural beauty 因为感慨自然之美稍纵即逝而产生的令人愉悦的忧伤
[SYNONYMS]congenial, delectable, delicious, delightful, dulcet, enjoyable, felicitous, gratifying, heavenly, palatable, pleasing, satisfying, savory
[ANTONYM]abhorrent, abominable, disagreeable, disgusting, loathsome, nauseating, repellent, repugnant, repulsive, revolting令人厌恶的
[MEANING 2]adj.随和的: having an easygoing and pleasing manner especially in social situations
[EXAMPLE]I have an agreeable art teacher who lets me do pretty much whatever I want.我的艺术老师性格非常好，总是允许我去做我想做的事情。
[SYNONYMS]affable, genial, good-natured, good-tempered, gracious, mellow, nice, pleasant, sweet, well-disposed
[ANTONYM]choleric, dyspeptic, fussy, grouchy, irascible, irritable, peevish, touchy 脾气不好的，易怒的
[MEANING 3]adj.相一致的: being in harmony
[EXAMPLE]These new security measures are not agreeable with our core concepts of personal freedom. 这些新的安保措施和我们所信仰的人身自由彼此抵触。
[SYNONYMS]amicable, compatible, congenial, consistent, consonant, frictionless, kindred, unanimous, united
[ANTONYM]disagreeable, discordant, disunited, incompatible, inharmonious 不一致的

[MEANING 3]adj.臃肿笨拙的，不优雅的: lacking ease or grace (as of movement or expression)
[MEANING 4]adj.令人尴尬的: causing embarrassment
[MEANING 5]adj.(因过大过重或设计问题)难以操作的: difficult to use or operate especially because of size, weight, or design
DESC:
[MEANING 1]adj.缺乏灵活性和技巧的: lacking dexterity or skill
[EXAMPLE]awkward with a needle and thread 缺乏灵巧的针线活技术
[SYNONYMS]handless, maladroit
[ANTONYM]adroit, deft, dexterous, proficient, skilled 灵巧的
[MEANING 2]adj.(处理问题)缺乏手段和智谋的: showing or marked by a lack of skill and tact (as in dealing with a situation)
[EXAMPLE]Her awkward handling of the seating arrangements resulted in many hurt feelings她那缺乏智谋的座次安排伤害了许多人的感情
[SYNONYMS]botched, bungling, fumbled, inept, inexpert, maladroit
[MEANING 3]adj.臃肿笨拙的，不优雅的: lacking ease or grace (as of movement or expression)
[EXAMPLE]an awkward design 一份粗劣的设计
[SYNONYMS]clumsy, gauche, graceless, gawkish
[ANTONYM]elegant, graceful, polished, lithe, coordinated 优雅的
[MEANING 4]adj.令人尴尬的: causing embarrassment
[EXAMPLE]the awkward situation of having to listen as your host and hostess quarrel loudly in the next room 不得不听着你的主人和她太太在隔壁大声争吵的尴尬境地
[SYNONYMS]discomfiting, disturbing, disconcerting, embarrassing, flustering
[MEANING 5]adj.(因过大过重或设计问题)难以操作的: difficult to use or operate especially because of size, weight, or design
[EXAMPLE]The manual can opener is too awkward to hold 那个手动启瓶器太难握了
[SYNONYMS]ponderous, ungainly, unhandy, unwieldy, bunglesome, cranky
[ANTONYM]handy 容易操纵的

MEANING: [MEANING 1]adj.简洁的，简明的: brief and to the point; effectively concise

MEANING:
[MEANING 1]n.许可，认可: the approval by someone in authority for the doing of something
[MEANING 2]n.自由: the right to act or move freely
[MEANING 3]n.放荡: disregard for standards of personal conduct
[MEANING 4]vt.准许，授权使用: to permit or authorize especially by formal license
DESC:
[MEANING 1]n.许可，认可: the approval by someone in authority for the doing of something
[EXAMPLE]The company is seeking license to operate several more power plants in the state.公司正在寻求在国内 建造更多电厂的许可。 A restaurant owner has to get a license to serve food and drink.餐厅营业者必须要获得食物和饮品的销售许可。
[SYNONYMS]allowance, authorization, clearance, concurrence, consent, empowerment, granting, sanction, warrant
[ANTONYM]interdiction, prohibition, proscription 禁止
[MEANING 2]n.自由: the right to act or move freely
[EXAMPLE]Military commanders on the ground must be granted considerable license, as wars cannot be micromanaged by people back in Washington. 战地指挥官应该被赋予相当大的自由，因为一场战争只靠华盛顿 的人是不可能打赢的。
[SYNONYMS]freedom, latitude, liberty
[ANTONYM]confinement, custody, imprisonment 拘留，囚禁
[MEANING 3]n.放荡: disregard for standards of personal conduct
[EXAMPLE]a night of drinking and license at the nightclub夜店里放纵饮酒取乐的一夜
[SYNONYMS]debauchery, hedonism, libertinage, libertinism, licentiousness, profligacy, voluptuousness
[ANTONYM]abstinence, asceticism, sobriety, temperance 节制，克制
[MEANING 4]vt.准许，授权使用: to permit or authorize especially by formal license
[EXAMPLE]A state statute licenses county sheriffs to choose their own deputies.法律允许郡上的司法长官选择自己的副手。 licensed to use deadly force获准使用致命火力
[SYNONYMS]accredit, certify, commission, empower, enable, invest, qualify, vest, warrant
[ANTONYM]disqualify 取消资格；forbid, interdict, prohibit, proscribe, veto 禁止

MEANING:
